This is really important to me, so I'm left to be creative to fulfill this goal of mine.  This is an opportunity to utilize the power of one's network in order to make a difference.  I hope to lead by example, and inspire others to do the same, as a friend has once done for me.  Thank you for being a part of this experience.

lenders.name: Michael
lenders.loan_because: I have been reading about micro-financing for some time and had become interested in participating. Also having traveled the world through my job, I have been to places where a few dollars could really make a difference in the lives of people unlike in the USA and other supposed "civilised" societies where a few dollars could do little than keep you satisfied with coffee and a doughnut. I am hopeful that the last statement does not come across as demeaning, I only hope to express the sentiment that in other societies a dollar can go a lot further without all of the burden of red-tape that seems to keep our society bogged down and unresponsive to true entrepreneurship at the grass-roots level!

lenders.name: Dillon
lenders.loan_because: I believe God has given me opportunities and resources in order to help others and ultimately to glorify the love, grace, and hope of Jesus Christ. In my experience, micro-finance and business have provided many opportunities to serve and build relationships which are also very important to me.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a young professional from Oklahoma City, Oklahoma. I studied international business at Oklahoma Baptist University and I currently work for Monte Cristo Ironworks L.L.C. I am interested in marketing, information technology, finance, and international business. I am currently living in Oklahoma City near my family and girlfriend, Jessica Herbert. However, I have traveled to several countries (Mexico, Canada, China, India, Belgium, France, Bahrain, and Egypt) and I hope that more international opportunities will arise in the future. I have worked in several countries on short term projects and I am very interested in international development projects such as micro-finance. I am a member of Eagle Heights Church and a follower of Jesus Christ. I enjoy learning about almost anything. I am currently finishing up a minor in cross-cultural ministry and I hope to continue my education possibly taking classes in physics/engineering and information technology/computer science. I enjoy the outdoors especially the beach and the ocean. I like playing volleyball, basketball, the guitar and also longboarding, scuba diving, and snorkeling. I also enjoy watching movies that make me think, watching the Oklahoma City Thunder's basketball games, the University of Oklahoma Sooners' s football games, as well as other sports, reading and watching the news, and wiking and reading books on almost any topic.
